data.title: The PC admin user password is going to expire soon or has already expired.
data.message: {alert_msg}

paramValue.stringValue: Admin user password will expire soon. Please change the admin password.

rootCauseAnalysis.cause: The PC admin password is going to expire soon or has already expired.
rootCauseAnalysis.resolution: Change the password for PC admin user or refer to KB-18014.

data.title: IAMv2 authentication Database Connectivity Error Warning
data.message: Postgres Database for IAM is serving requests from Authn pod in > 100ms for  66.66666666666666% of requests.

rootCauseAnalysis.cause: IAMv2 Postgres DB is slow to respond to requests or unavailable
rootCauseAnalysis.resolution: Check the iam-user-authn and postgres-* pods on MSP

data.title: Microservices Infrastructure is not in healthy state.
data.message: Microservices Infrastructure is not in healthy state. Please check for errors in logs or contact Nutanix Support

rootCauseAnalysis.cause: This alert indicates that either Microservice Infrastructure enablement has failed or the components are in an unhealthy state.
rootCauseAnalysis.resolution: Check for any error in logs or contact Nutanix Support. Refer to KB-13136 for more details and troubleshooting steps.

data.title: IAM services are not in healthy state.
data.message: One or more IAM services have restarted within the last 15 minutes. Users may face Authentication/Authorization issues. Errors: {alert_message}

paramValue.stringValue: IAM Authorization Service (Themis) is down. IAM Authentication Service (Authn) is down.

rootCauseAnalysis.cause: IAM services are not in a healthy state which may lead to Authentication/Authorization issues for users.
rootCauseAnalysis.resolution: If this alert occurs more than once, please collect Prism Central VM (PCVM) and MSP logs and contact Nutanix support. Additionally you can refer to KB article 16775 for resolution details.

data.title: Cluster Service {services} Restarting Frequently
data.message: There have been multiple service restarts of {services} across all Controller VM(s). Latest crash of these services have occurred at {timestamps} respectively.

rootCauseAnalysis.cause: This alert indicates that one or more services in the cluster were restarted.
rootCauseAnalysis.resolution: If this alert occurs once or infrequently, no action is necessary. If it is frequent, contact Nutanix support.

data.title: IAM services are not in healthy state.
data.message: One or more IAM services have restarted within the last 15 minutes. Users may face Authentication/Authorization issues. Errors: {alert_message}

rootCauseAnalysis.cause: IAM services are not in a healthy state which may lead to Authentication/Authorization issues for users.
rootCauseAnalysis.resolution: If this alert occurs more than once, please collect Prism Central VM (PCVM) and MSP logs and contact Nutanix support. Additionally you can refer to KB article 16775 for resolution details.

data.title: IAMv2 authorization Database Connectivity Error Warning
data.message: Postgres Database for IAM is serving requests from Themis pod in > 100ms for  80.00000000000001% of requests.

rootCauseAnalysis.cause: IAMv2 Postgres DB is slow to respond to requests or unavailable
rootCauseAnalysis.resolution: Check the themis and postgres-* pods on MSP

data.title: Prism Central VM CPU Load High
data.message: CPU load in or Prism Central VM {ip_address} is high. Load average over 5 Minutes = {load_average_5min}, number of vCPUs in CVM or Prism Central VM = {num_procs}.

rootCauseAnalysis.cause: The CPU load on the Prism Central VM has been high.
rootCauseAnalysis.resolution: Contact Nutanix Support for diagnosis. CPU on the Prism Central VM may need to be increased.

data.title: Cluster Service {services} Restarting Frequently
data.message: There have been multiple service restarts of {services} across all Controller VM(s). Latest crash of these services have occurred at {timestamps} respectively.

rootCauseAnalysis.cause: This alert indicates that one or more services in the cluster were restarted.
rootCauseAnalysis.resolution: If this alert occurs once or infrequently, no action is necessary. If it is frequent, contact Nutanix support.

data.title: Cluster Service {services} Restarting Frequently
data.message: There have been multiple service restarts of {services} across all Controller VM(s). Latest crash of these services have occurred at {timestamps} respectively.

rootCauseAnalysis.cause: This alert indicates that one or more services in the cluster were restarted.
rootCauseAnalysis.resolution: If this alert occurs once or infrequently, no action is necessary. If it is frequent, contact Nutanix support.

data.title: Prism Central VM CPU Load High
data.message: CPU load in or Prism Central VM {ip_address} is high. Load average over 5 Minutes = {load_average_5min}, number of vCPUs in CVM or Prism Central VM = {num_procs}.

rootCauseAnalysis.cause: The CPU load on the Prism Central VM has been high.
rootCauseAnalysis.resolution: Contact Nutanix Support for diagnosis. CPU on the Prism Central VM may need to be increased.

data.title: Domain Manager Internal Service has Stopped Working
data.message: Discovered that the Domain Manager internal service is not working: '{service_names}'

rootCauseAnalysis.cause: Domain Manager internal service may have stopped working
rootCauseAnalysis.resolution: Please refer to KB-13120

data.title: RAM Usage high on {vm_type} : {ip_address}
data.message: Main memory usage in {vm_type} {ip_address} is high, {available_memory_kb} KB is free.

rootCauseAnalysis.cause: The RAM usage on the Controller VM or Prism Central VM has been high.
rootCauseAnalysis.resolution: Check the memory utilization of Prism Central VM or Controller VM. If abnormal behavior is seen, please collect logs and contact Nutanix Support.

data.title: RAM Usage high on {vm_type} : {ip_address}
data.message: Main memory usage in {vm_type} {ip_address} is high, {available_memory_kb} KB is free.

rootCauseAnalysis.cause: The RAM usage on the Controller VM or Prism Central VM has been high.
rootCauseAnalysis.resolution: Check the memory utilization of Prism Central VM or Controller VM. If abnormal behavior is seen, please collect logs and contact Nutanix Support.

data.title: RAM Usage high on {vm_type} : {ip_address}
data.message: Main memory usage in {vm_type} {ip_address} is high, {available_memory_kb} KB is free.

rootCauseAnalysis.cause: The RAM usage on the Controller VM or Prism Central VM has been high.
rootCauseAnalysis.resolution: Check the memory utilization of Prism Central VM or Controller VM. If abnormal behavior is seen, please collect logs and contact Nutanix Support.

data.title: Degraded VM Recovery Point.
data.message: Recovery Point for VM {vm_name} failed to capture associated policies and categories because {reason}.

paramValue.stringValue: Management plane is not available to get the configuration

rootCauseAnalysis.cause: Recovery Point for VM failed to capture associated policies and categories.
rootCauseAnalysis.resolution: Check the connection between PC and the PE, then retry the Recovery Point operation.

data.title: Pulse is not enabled on cluster.
data.message: Pulse is not enabled on cluster

rootCauseAnalysis.cause: Pulse is not enabled on cluster.
rootCauseAnalysis.resolution: Ensure that pulse is enabled on the cluster to allow Nutanix to provide proactive support.

data.title: IAM services are not in healthy state.
data.message: One or more IAM services have restarted within the last 15 minutes. Users may face Authentication/Authorization issues. Errors: {alert_message}

paramValue.stringValue: Failed to connect to IAM Proxy Service.

rootCauseAnalysis.cause: IAM services are not in a healthy state which may lead to Authentication/Authorization issues for users.
rootCauseAnalysis.resolution: If this alert occurs more than once, please collect Prism Central VM (PCVM) and MSP logs and contact Nutanix support. Additionally you can refer to KB article 16775 for resolution details.

data.title: The PC is using password based ssh access.
data.message: {alert_msg}

paramValue.stringValue: Password-based remote login is enabled on the PCVM. It is recommended to use key-based ssh access instead of password-based ssh access for better security.

rootCauseAnalysis.cause: The SSH security of the PCVM is weak.
rootCauseAnalysis.resolution: Change the SSH security setting of the PCVM.

data.title: Prism Central {pcvm_ip} is using default password
data.message: Please update the default password(s) on the PC for user(s): {users} to harden the security on the clusters. Nutanix recommends immediately changing all default passwords.

rootCauseAnalysis.cause: SSH access credentials have not changed from the shipped default.
rootCauseAnalysis.resolution: Ensure that Prism Central is using a custom password for improved security. Please change the default password(s).

data.title: Pulse is disabled
data.message: Pulse is disabled on the paired Prism Central {cluster_uuid}

rootCauseAnalysis.cause: Pulse enablement might be missed or disabled.
rootCauseAnalysis.resolution: Enable Pulse on current cluster and all of its registered clusters.

data.title: License Feature Violation
data.message: Features not permitted by license(s) applied are being used. Non compliant features: {feature_violation_list}

paramValue.stringValue:
Max replication factor| Storage Container default-container-64072168813867:Configured Replication factor value 2 is greater than permitted value 0
Max replication factor| Storage Container NutanixManagementShare:Configured Replication factor value 2 is greater than permitted value 0
Max replication factor| Storage Container SelfServiceContainer:Configured Replication factor value 2 is greater than permitted value 0
Max nodes| Cluster Configuration:Configured Number of nodes value 1 is greater than permitted value 0
Lock down| Cluster configuration:Cluster lockdown enabled

rootCauseAnalysis.cause: The cluster was configured to use features not allowed by the license.
rootCauseAnalysis.resolution: Apply a license with the necessary entitlement or stop using the unlicensed features.

data.title: Cluster Service {services} Restarting Frequently
data.message: There have been multiple service restarts of {services} across all Controller VM(s). Latest crash of these services have occurred at {timestamps} respectively.

rootCauseAnalysis.cause: This alert indicates that one or more services in the cluster were restarted.
rootCauseAnalysis.resolution: If this alert occurs once or infrequently, no action is necessary. If it is frequent, contact Nutanix support.
